moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5 4. b4: the evans gambit!! i never get the chance to play this.
moves.4... Bxb4 5. c3 Bc5 6. d4 exd4: at this point i'm thinking he will pull back the bishop, but he takes at d4.
moves.7. cxd4: afer that exchange i feel very good with my big center. at this point im going to get my pieces going as fast as possible and get the attack on.
moves.7... Bb6 8. Nc3 d6 9. O-O: im thinking at this point i should not have castled but to continue to devolop as my king was not in any danger.
moves.9... Nf6 10. Nd5: i moved my knight up thinking he would exchange and get rid of a key kingside defender. also that would give me a nice posted bishop for a bit.
moves.10... Ba5 11. e5: trying to force the exchange at d5
moves.11... dxe5 12. dxe5 Nd7 13. Bf4 O-O: by this time i have good development and a kingside attack coming.
moves.14. h4 h6: i am licking my chops at h6.
moves.15. Qc1 Nc5 16. Rd1: trying a tactic to win the queen.
